page.title: 07Occupations in Wytham (1)
page.content: Wytham is a village where the patterns of people's occupations has not chaned greatly during the last century. In 1881 32 men were labourers, most working on he land. 20 women were in domestic service, 8 of these being laundresses, 1 a dairymaid and 1 a needewoman. The hierarchy of servants ranged from a butler and a parlourmaid to a carwoman. There were 3 nurses in the village. Masons and carpenters, gamekeepers and gardeners could be found in Wytham.The school had a mistress, a teacher and a scholar teacher and 44 pupils. The inn was run by the publican and a barmaid. In the Abbey lived a Magistrate. A curate was in charge of the church, a clerk was responsible for parish affairs, 7 farmers worked the land, and there were 3 butchers dealing with the meat provided by forest and farm animals.
